text: We excluded 11 cases from the analysis due to inhibition of the PCR . Out of the remaining 2 , 219 pneumonia cases , Infection with more than one virus was identified in 29 ( 3 . 3 % ) of the 887 positive specimens . The most common double infection was PIV3 in combination with hMPV , which was found in nine cases . We identified three viruses in one case ( PIV1 , PIV2 , RSV ) and four viruses in another ( PIV1 , PIV2 , InfB , RSV ) .
